newsitem.title: USA: Public Service Co/Colo. files $400 mln shelf.
newsitem.headline: Public Service Co/Colo. files $400 mln shelf.

text.p: Public Service Co of Colorado filed Thursday with the Securities and Exchange Commission a shelf registration for up to $400 million in first collateral trust bonds.
Of the total, $250 million will be offered as secured medium-term notes, which are part of the series of the bonds to be issued, the Denver-based company said.

Net proceeds will be used to refinance matured or maturing debt incurred to fund "defueling" expenses of the company's Fort St. Vrain nuclear generating station, to fund the company's construction program and for other general corporate purposes.
The notes will be offered through Merrill Lynch & Co and Goldman, Sachs & Co.
